workflow.name: Automate Zoom attendee segmentation in KlickTipp based on participation
workflow.description:
![Zoom Meeting participants transfer to KlickTipp.png](fileId:2686)

**Community Node Disclaimer**: This workflow uses KlickTipp community nodes.

### Introduction  
This workflow automates the end-to-end integration between **Zoom** and **KlickTipp**.  
It listens to Zoom webinar events (specifically `meeting.ended`), validates incoming webhooks, retrieves participant data from Zoom, and applies segmentation in KlickTipp by subscribing and tagging participants based on their attendance duration.  

This enables precise, automated campaign targeting without manual effort.  

---

### How It Works  

1. **Zoom Webhook Listener**  
   - Captures `meeting.ended` events from Zoom.  
   - Validates initial webhook registration via **HMAC** before processing.  

2. **Webhook Response Handling**  
   - Distinguishes between Zoom‚Äôs URL validation requests and actual event data.  
   - Sends appropriate responses (`plainToken` + `encryptedToken` for validation, or simple `status: ok` for regular events).  

3. **Data Retrieval**  
   - Waits briefly (1 second) to ensure meeting data is available.  
   - Pulls the participant list from Zoom‚Äôs `past_meetings/{uuid}/participants` endpoint.  

4. **Participant Processing**  
   - Splits the list into individual participant items.  
   - Filters out internal users (like the host).  
   - Routes participants based on the **meeting topic** (e.g., *Anf√§nger* vs. *Experten* webinar).  

5. **Attendance Segmentation**  
   - Subscribes each participant to KlickTipp with mapped fields (first name, last name, email).  
   - Uses conditions to check attendance thresholds:  
     - **‚â• 90% of total meeting duration ‚Üí Full attendance**  
     - Otherwise ‚Üí General attendance  
   - Applies corresponding KlickTipp tags per meeting type.  

---

### Key Features  

- ‚úÖ **Webhook Validation & Security** with HMAC (SHA256).  
- ‚úÖ **Automated Attendance Calculation** using participant `duration` vs. meeting `duration`.  
- ‚úÖ **Dynamic Routing** by meeting topic for multiple webinars.  
- ‚úÖ **KlickTipp Integration** with:  
  - Subscriber creation or update.  
  - Tagging for full vs. general attendance.  
- ‚úÖ **Scalable Structure** for adding more webinars by extending the Switch and tagging branches.  

---

### Setup Instructions  

**Zoom Setup**  
- Enable **Zoom API access** and OAuth2 app credentials.  
- Configure webhook event `meeting.ended`.  
- Grant scopes:  
  - `meeting:read:meeting`  
  - `meeting:read:list_past_participants`  

**KlickTipp Setup**  
- Prepare custom fields:  
  - `Zoom | meeting selection` (Text)  
  - `Zoom | meeting start` (Date & Time)  
  - `Zoom | Join URL` (URL)  
  - `Zoom | Registration ID` (Text)  
  - `Zoom | Duration meeting` (Text)  
- Create tags for each meeting variation:  
  - `attended`, `attended fully`, `not attended` per meeting name.  

**n8n Setup**  
- Add Zoom webhook node (`Listen to ending Zoom meetings`).  
- Configure validation nodes (`Crypto`, `Build Validation Body`).  
- Set up HTTP Request node with Zoom OAuth2 credentials.  
- Connect KlickTipp nodes with your KlickTipp API credentials.  

---

### Testing & Deployment  

1. End a test Zoom meeting connected to this workflow.  
2. Verify that:  
   - The webhook triggers correctly.  
   - Participant list is fetched.  
   - Internal users are excluded.  
   - Participants are subscribed and tagged in KlickTipp.  
3. Check contact records in KlickTipp for tag and field updates.  

üí° *Pro Tip*: Use test emails and manipulate `duration` values to confirm segmentation logic.  

---

### Customization Ideas  

- Adjust attendance thresholds (e.g., 80% instead of 90%).  
- Add additional meeting topics via the Switch node.  
- Trigger email campaigns in KlickTipp based on attendance tags.  
- Expand segmentation with more granular ranges (e.g., 0‚Äì30%, 30‚Äì60%, 60‚Äì90%).  
- Add error handling for missing Zoom data or API failures.

**Resources:**  
- [Use KlickTipp Community Node in n8n](https://www.klicktipp.com/support/knowledge-base/install-klicktipp-node-n8n/)
- [Automate Workflows: KlickTipp Integration in n8n](https://www.klicktipp.com/support/knowledge-base/klicktipp-integration-n8n/)

nodes.name: Crypto
nodes.notes: This node prepares the response to the Zoom endpoint in order to answer to the validation.

nodes.name: Build Validation Body
nodes.notes: This node builds the body for the response to the Zoom endpoint in order to answer for validation.

nodes.name: Respond to Webhook (Validation)
nodes.notes: This node sends the response back to the Zoom endpoint.

nodes.name: Build Normal Event Body
nodes.notes: This node builds a body for a response to the endpoint in case of a regular event.

nodes.name: Respond to Webhook (Events)
nodes.notes: This node answers to the endpoint in case of regular Zoom events - such as ending meetings in this case.

nodes.name: URL Validation check
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the received data was a ending meeting or a URL validation call by Zoom.

parameters.content: ## Pulling webinar data - participants and absentees

nodes.name: Tag participant with full attendance1
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended more than 90% of the webinar.

nodes.name: Tag participant for full attendance
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended more than 90% of the webinar.

parameters.content:
Community Node Disclaimer: This workflow uses KlickTipp community nodes.


### Introduction
This workflow automates the end-to-end integration between Zoom and KlickTipp using n8n. It listens to Zoom meeting events (specifically, when a meeting ends), fetches attendance data, subscribes the participants and tags them in KlickTipp based on how long they attended. This enables precise segmentation for follow-ups and campaign automation based on actual user engagement.

### Benefits
- **Fully automated tagging**: No manual effort‚Äîparticipants are tagged in KlickTipp based on attendance percentage.
- **Precise segmentation**: Supports differentiated tags for full, partial, or no attendance per meeting type.
- **Dual-meeting support**: Handles multiple meeting types (e.g. Beginner vs. Expert) in one automated flow.

### Key Features
- **Zoom Webhook Listener**:
  - Reacts to `meeting.ended` events.
  - Validates Zoom URL on webhook registration using HMAC.
- **Zoom API Integration**:
  - Pulls past meeting details and participant list using meeting UUID.
  - Uses `duration` fields to calculate attendance.
- **Conditional Logic**:
  - Uses Switch nodes to differentiate meetings by topic.
  - Filters out internal users.
  - Applies IF logic to check attendance thresholds (e.g. ‚â•‚ÄØ90%, ‚â•‚ÄØ60%).
- **KlickTipp Subscription & Tagging**:
  - Subscribes participant to KlickTipp based on meeting data
  - Applies different tags for each attendance segment:
    - Full attendance (‚â•‚ÄØ90%)
    - General attendance
    - No attendance
  - Supports tagging per meeting name (ex.: meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger vs. meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten).
- **Scalable Structure**:
  - Easily extendable to more meetings by duplicating the Switch and tagging logic.

### Setup Instructions
**Zoom Preparation**
   - Ensure Zoom API access is enabled.
   - Set up recurring meetings or meetings.
   - Enable webhook event `meeting.ended` for your Zoom webhook and the scopes `meeting:read:meeting`, `meeting:read:list_past_participants`.

**KlickTipp Preparation**
   - Create these custom fields (if not already present):
  - `Zoom | meeting selection` (Text)
- `Zoom | meeting start` (Date & Time)
- `Zoom | Join URL` (URL)
- `Zoom | Registration ID` (Text)
- `Zoom | Duration meeting` (Text)

  - Manually add the following tags:
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended fully`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger not attended`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended fully`
     - `Zoom meeting E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten not attended`


**n8n Configuration**
   - Configure the webhook node for the Zoom endpoint and connect it to your webhook.
   - Set up API credentials for Zoom and KlickTipp.
  

### Testing and Deployment
1. End a Zoom meeting connected to the flow.
2. Verify:
   - The webhook triggers.
   - Participants are fetched from Zoom.
   - Tags are applied correctly in KlickTipp.
3. Review KlickTipp contact records for tag and custom field updates.

> üí° *Pro Tip*: Use test emails and simulate different durations to validate tagging logic.

### Campaign Expansion Ideas
- Add additional meeting topics and tag logic by extending the Switch node.
- Trigger personalized email sequences in KlickTipp based on attendance status.
- Combine this workflow with registration tracking for full-funnel automation.
- Use conditional routing to send follow-ups only to specific attendance segments.

### Customization
- Update tag names in the KlickTipp nodes to match your campaign naming convention.
- Adjust attendance thresholds (e.g. 80% instead of 90%) in IF nodes.
- Add fallback conditions for missing data or error handling on Zoom API calls.
- Use more granular time ranges for segmentation of attendance (e.g. 0‚Äì30%, 30‚Äì60%, etc.).

nodes.name: Filter internal users
nodes.notes: This node filters out internal users from the webinar such as the host.

nodes.name: Split webinar participants
nodes.notes: This node iterates through all participants.

nodes.name: Route by webinar name
nodes.notes: This node filters for the different webinars via the name in order to process them.

nodes.name: Check full attendance
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 90% in the webinar or not.

nodes.name: Check full attendance1
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 90% in the webinar or not.

nodes.name: Wait 1 second
nodes.notes: This node waits 1 second to avoid calling the past webinar to early before it is available.

nodes.name: Listen to ending Zoom meetings
nodes.notes: This node is listening to Zoom events and triggers when a webinar was ended.

nodes.name: Get past Zoom meeting participants
nodes.notes: This node pulls data of the webinar participants in order to process them.

nodes.name: Subscribe participant
nodes.notes: This node subscribes the participant based on the meeting data as a new contact in KlickTipp or updates it.

nodes.name: Subscribe participant1
nodes.notes: This node subscribes the participant based on the meeting data as a new contact in KlickTipp or updates it.

dataFields.fieldValue: ={{    /* take "name" or empty string if missing */ ($json.name || '')     /* trim leading/trailing whitespace */ .trim()     /* split into words by any whitespace */ .split(/\s+/)     /* get last word */ .slice(-1)[0]     /* fallback */ || '' }}

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Crypto node allows you to hash and Hmac string in a specified format and sign a string using a private key. Use this node when you want to encrypt your data.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
